data.title: Home Page
data.meta_description: Digestive Disease Week® It’s All About Your Path Washington, D.C. & Online    May 18-21, 2024 Washington, D.C. & Online May 18-21, 2024 Days Hours Minutes Seconds Days Hours Minutes Seconds Book Exhibit Space Buy DDW On Demand Claim Your CME Book 2024 Exhibit Space Purchase 2023 On Demand Post-Meeting Resources Thank you for attending DDW […]
data.text: 6 a.m.Registration6 a.m.–5 p.m.8 a.m.Scientific Sessions8 a.m.–5:30 p.m.In-person attendees will have credentials to attend 400 original scientific sessions. Online attendees can watch four channels with 64 key scientific sessions (livestreamed). All in-person sessions will also be available on demand after DDW ends.AGA Postgraduate Course 8 a.m.–5:30 p.m.Join us to explore challenging patient cases, high-impact papers and important practice updates that you can use immediately implement upon your return to the clinic. Participate in-person during the first day of DDW® or online from the comfort of your home—the choice is yours!AASLD Basic Science Emerging Topics Conference8 a.m.–5:30 p.m.Join AASLD for enlightening sessions where experts delve into groundbreaking research at the intersection of microbiome science and liver health. Participants will explore the profound impact of alcohol on liver health and how the microbiome plays a pivotal role in treating alcohol-associated liver diseases.9:30 a.m.Poster Sessions and ePosters9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.The Poster Hall will be organized by DDW Tracks to allow attendees to easily find posters of interest by topic and theme. ePosters takes DDW posters online, where you can easily search at your convenience to find the latest research that interests you.6 a.m.Registration6 a.m.–5 p.m.6:30 a.m.DDW Breakfast Connections 6:30–7:45 a.m.These are scholarly, dynamic morning discussions in an informal, small-group atmosphere. Breakfast is included and space is limited.ASGE Annual Postgraduate Course: Clinical Challenges and Real-Time Decision Making in GI EndoscopyThis annual signature ASGE event brings together experts from across the globe to present evidence-based and outcomes-driven endoscopic management of gastrointestinal and related disorders. Enjoy discussions on tools, techniques, tips and tricks to achieve your own optimal outcomes for general and advanced diagnostic and therapeutic endoscopy. With a mix of didactic lectures, case-based discussions, video cases and panel discussions, you can expect an interactive experience that will equip you for real-time decision making in tackling clinical challenges in your GI unit.8 a.m.Scientific Sessions8 a.m.–5:30 p.m.In-person attendees will have credentials to attend 400 original scientific sessions. Online attendees can watch four channels with 64 key scientific sessions (livestreamed). All in-person sessions will also be available on demand after DDW ends.AASLD Basic Science Emerging Topics Conference 8 a.m.–NoonJoin AASLD for enlightening sessions where experts delve into groundbreaking research at the intersection of microbiome science and liver health. Participants will explore the profound impact of alcohol on liver health and how the microbiome plays a pivotal role in treating alcohol-associated liver diseases.9:30 a.m.Poster Sessions and ePosters9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.The Poster Hall will be organized by DDW Tracks to allow attendees to easily find posters of interest by topic and theme. ePosters takes DDW posters online, where you can easily search at your convenience to find the latest research that interests you.Exhibit Hall9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.See the latest GI innovations, access special offers, and discuss your specific needs with trusted industry partners.World IBD Day BreakfastSponsored by Lilly USAPack your purple and join us for breakfast in the Exhibit Hall to kick off World IBD Day. Purple World IBD Day awareness ribbons will be passed out to the first 3,000 attendees.12:30 p.m.DDW Meet-the-Professor and Meet-the-Investigator Luncheons12:30–1:45 p.m.Participate in a scholarly, dynamic discussion in an informal, small-group atmosphere. A boxed lunch is included. Space is limited.4 p.m.DDW Diversity Session4–5:30 p.m.This session will highlight unique issues concerning diversity in the gastroenterology, hepatology and surgical fields as they relate to academia and various clinical practice settings. A reception will immediately follow.6 a.m.Registration6 a.m.–5 p.m.6:30 a.m.DDW Breakfast Connections 6:30–7:45 a.m.These are scholarly, dynamic morning discussions in an informal, small-group atmosphere. Breakfast is included and space is limited.8 a.m.Scientific Sessions8 a.m.–5:30 p.m.In-person attendees will have credentials to attend 400 original scientific sessions. Online attendees can watch four channels with 64 key scientific sessions (livestreamed). All in-person sessions will also be available on demand after DDW ends.SSAT Presidential Address and Presidential Plenary8 a.m.–10:45 a.m.Join the SSAT in celebrating the Presidency of Vic Velanovich, MD, during the SSAT Presidential Address. This session will include an address from the president along with top papers in GI surgery featured in the 2024 program.9:30 a.m.Poster Sessions and ePosters9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.The Poster Hall will be organized by DDW Tracks to allow attendees to easily find posters of interest by topic and theme. ePosters takes DDW posters online, where you can easily search at your convenience to find the latest research that interests you.Exhibit Hall9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.See the latest GI innovations, access special offers, and discuss your specific needs with trusted industry partners.12:30 p.m.DDW Meet-the-Professor and Meet-the-Investigator Luncheons 12:30–1:45 p.m.Participate in a scholarly, dynamic discussion in an informal, small-group atmosphere. A boxed lunch is included. Space is limited.4 p.m.DDW Shark Tank4–5:30 p.m.This session will be a fun, high energy and entertaining, interactive session featuring “innovators” from each society who will pitch their best scientific innovations/research. The sharks and audience will vote on the best innovation.
